alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Gove; Graham; Greeley; Logan; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Thomas; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 01 at 12:03PM CST until January 02 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MST /2 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Blowing snow remains possible this afternoon with winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Wind chills will fall to 15 to 25 degrees below zero overnight and tomorrow night. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...The Wind Chill Advisory for Saturday morning has been extended, until 1 PM MST /2 PM CST/ this afternoon. The second Wind Chill Advisory will be in effect from 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon to 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult with patchy blowing snow expected reduce visibility at times. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold wind chills could be dangerous for vulnerable populations and livestock. If traveling for the holiday make sure to take proper precautions if an emergency occurs. Wind chills Sunday morning may be colder than 30 below zero in localized areas.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Decatur; Gove; Graham; Greeley; Logan; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Thomas; Wallace; Wichita
